text: Hey All. We've just published a few of the sessions (and re-organized the agenda) for Developer Day. Take a look and if you haven't registered yet, make sure to do so if you can make it!
<https://offers.HubSpot.com/developer-day-2017>
There's a cap to registrations this year, so if you are going to be in-town for INBOUND and want to come to Developer Day (and think you can make it) it would be good to register.
<@U22PU4G4A> pinned a message to this channel.

<!here|@here> - Working on some tshirt designs for ya'll in the HubSpot Developer Community ... let me know your thoughts (would you wear this all the time???). :slightly_smiling_face:

Brutal feedback appreciated. Don't sugar coat, I can take it :slightly_smiling_face:
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
Also my first thought lmao
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
Maybe throw the heart between some brackets? < :heart: > ?
Or make it straight HubL syntax?
Not enough people would get it :disappointed:
Perhaps if you actually put a codeblock that simulated the output of the "HubSpot Developer Community Member" heard
heart**
pseudocode of course
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
keep feedback coming :slightly_smiling_face:
I'll add the opening {

adding bracket to the back? 
Thumbs up -or- is that too much?
Updated front... look correct/better? :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U504BHZ6K|rbenzing> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/rbenzing/F6WJF4DK7/pasted_image_at_2017_08_31_10_19_am.png|what if it was like this?>
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
This way its a class with developing as a function and the future is our variable :smile:
it would be pretty rad to have the front be pure code... then the back be the output. :stuck_out_tongue:
that may turn into a lot of text on the front :stuck_out_tongue:
HubSpot in binary?

I tried this... but this just doesn't "pop" for me. The marketer in me also would like to see a logo in there :stuck_out_tongue:  

Any thoughts on this? Is this better?

People would probably understand it better if it was split view with Code + Render view (like code version on left and "Preview" version on right (where youd see the code output -- could include logo there)

I think I'm getting hung up on what the language is supposed to be lol. If JS, you could always:
var HubSpot = logo
or
const HubSpot = logo
I didn't have any specific language in mind
originally it wasn't meant to be actual code -> output... but I do sort of like that idea.
the code editor / preview would help it make more sense
but worried that would be a very busy front tee

could someone please take a second and send me the full code if done in HTML/CSS/JS (or whatever makes sense)
And i'll mock it up to see what it might look like
pseudo-code for sure (doesn't need to be full / functioning IMO) just LOOK like it might work given some (unseen) imports, links, references, libraries, etc
mockup on tees
Oh it's way bigger than I expected
<@U2H3TT8F2|ajlaporte> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/ajlaporte/F6XHPEFT9/pasted_image_at_2017_08_31_09_46_am.png|Pasted image at 2017-08-31, 9:46 AM>
Just an idea if you were worried about the front being busy, maybe make like a pocket-sized terminal / code window? Maybe throw in some UI decorations?
<@U2H3TT8F2> This is what I was thinking
and +1 for HubL use
it only makes sense
and people at Dev day will appreciate it
I'd go for the breast pocket placement with the logo centered there
rather than full- centered
but what do i know >_<
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
Community win
heart as outline might be better than a big heart as shown.
I love it, and the effort put in a brilliant design and message!!!
love the idea <@U2H3TT8F2> ... let me make a new mockup ... 1 sec
ps. LOVE the community effort to get a cool design we all love :sparkling_heart:

I'm loving it... send to print? :slightly_smiling_face:
Thumbs up or down?

only last tweak I"m thinking if flipping the front... so the "Developing the future on HubSpot" is on top... and the code editor is on bottom. 
Right now, from a design perspective, the front looks a bit bottom heavy which is a little weird

Thoughts on that?
You do have one extra blank line in your code editor :wink:
could help
Wouldn't bother me if they were flipped (but I'd have to see it)
Alt concept: Backend code (code editor) on back of shirt
Front-end on front (render view)
May want to then put Developer Community Member under the HubSpot logo on the front
in the orange text you have there
i.e. typographical rather than set in heart

Flipped around.... I like it much better. More balanced. 

OK - I'm done filling up the chat for today :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks for all the ideas and feedback everyone. Excited to get these printed for INBOUND. Make sure to come to HubSpot Dev Day (Jeffrey posted details up above) to get yours :slightly_smiling_face:
but i have other conflicts... :disappointed: can i get one sent for helping make it :wink:
I'll DM ya
*cough* - also unable to attend - *cough*
Anyone have an inbound ticket they don't need that I can transfer to some from my team?
Not sure If i will actually be there but these are fantastic.
